_comment: Created by EFisher on 25/02/2014 18:26:53 using v2.0
title: Is the number of calls responsible for the standard breach in the month?
analysis_commentary:
Nationally there does appear to be an inverse relationship between the total number of calls and the percentage that can be responded to within the eight minutes; higher call activity reduces the chance that a single call will be responded to in eight minutes. However, the total number of calls doesn't appear to be the sole reason for the breach of the national standard in a given month as breaches are not always associated with increased call activity and increased call activity doesn't always result in a breach.

Further investigation of what is happening to cause breaches would be needed and is not down solely to activity in response to ambulance calls that are classed as life threatening.
data_source: NHS England, Ambulance Quality Indicators: System Indicators
